column7: description
A decent soldering iron makes soldering much less painful. This 40W iron is a decent not too expensive option.
Best way to make holes in sheets quickly and assemble with wood screws etc
For cutting beetle and feather parts out of HDPE sheet, a jigsaw is a great tool. Try your local hackspace if you want to use larger tools like a bandsaw.
Good value transmitter for AFHDS/flysky recievers. Can have multiple profiles for multiple robots and has mixing.
A transmitter than runs Open Tx and has a multiprotocol module so will work with many receivers. Requires Li-on batteries, sold separately.
Nice and small and relatively cheap Flysky (AFDHS2A) receiver for transmitters like the FS-i6. Supports 2S direct so no BEC required for most ants.
Always charge your lipo battery in a lipo bag and don't leave it unattended!
If you're just charging ants / 2S lipos this is a nice cheap way to start out!
Good tiny charger for up to 4S lipos, great for ants and beetles if you have a USB C charger!
Great small charger for 1-6S Lipos with USB C support
Great for fast charging lipos of all sizes! Not cheap, and chinese postage, shop around for deals.
these are the most common motor for antweight drive. 6V 600rpm work great on 2S lipos. Can also be used for axes. Other geared versions of the n20 are used as weapons - 100rpm are great for lifters.
If you need to save a bit of weight and space, Nuts & Bots with BBB stock N10s which are essentially shorter, more powerful N20s!
these can be 3D printed or bought. Holds your n20 drive motors in place to your chassis.
Our special version of the dual ESC with centre braking for a better driving experience. still built in mixing and cheap!
Compact Triple ESC with a built in flysky receiver. Not recommended for first time builders, but a great way to save weight and space.
A great option for space and weight saving - solders to the back of N20 or N10 motors and plugs straight into your receiver.
Cheap ant wheels! Does the job. Superglue the tyres on to the hubs for battle.
Nice and grippy custom made for antweights.
Another grippy option if you're looking for small wheels
An all metal geared servo that runs on 2S so no BEC required.
Faster all metal for flippers, runs on 2S, no BEC required.
Fast but pricey servo - for flippers! Runs on 2S, no BEC required.
We don't recommend spinners for first time builders. Motor & electronics needed for a spinner - get a suitable weapon blade from drizzlebots.co.uk
Big range of lipos here - Choose JST and 120mah for the most weight saving, 200 or 250mah if you plan to run a spinner.
UK stocker of ant sized 2S lipos
UK stocker of ant sized 2S lipos
Wire inline with red wire of battery input connector for an on/off switch
Connector used for most ant batteries. Easy to use to create a link or wire in a switch.
Sufficient armour and chassis structure for Antweights, and can be cut with scissors! Another option if you have access to a 3D printer is to 3D print your chassis.
Good at taking hits and easily cut with a hacksaw - buy 1-2mm thick sheets for chassis
Good way to fasten panels together at right angles
Used on the end of wedges and flippers. Attach with double sided tape to help get your bot underneath others.
More robust and lighter weight beetle motors than 25mms, can be ran at 4S on BBB ESCs!
Face plates for all 22mm planetary motors, mount into a wall of your robot with a 22mm hole for the gearbox to sit in.
center braking, current limiting, well suited to 2 or 4WD on 22mms at 4S!
All the specs of the BBB single ESC times two in one package with built in drive mixing!
4S, center braking, current limiting, all the good stuff!
These mount directly to motors with 4mm or 6mm shafts and can be attached to a variety of FingerTech Foam Wheels.
Foam wheels for beetleweights in a variety of sizes, designed to take the shock from your drive motors. Add liquid latex for extra grip.
Hub for attaching to your gearmotor with threaded M3 holes for attaching your own custom wheels (usually 3D printed with molded PU)
This Servo plugs directly into your receiver, can be powered off by a 3A BEC and is powerful enough for a lifter, or potentially a grabbing device.
Use with a speed controller such as a BBB beetle single ESC. 100rpm or less for lifters, higher rpm for axes.
A good servo for running directly on 3S for more lifting power. Some people have had success on 4S - bit pricier though & shipped from china.
We recommend a 3S lipo for first beetles with an XT30 connector, capacity of 500-850mAh. If you want a bit more speed and power at the potential cost of some control, go for a 4S lipo.
We like GNB for compact 3S and 4S Lipos 500-850mah in size
BEC - battery eliminator circuit, reducing your battery voltage to 5v for your reciever and any servos you may wish to power off the reciever.
BEC - battery eliminator circuit, reducing your battery voltage to 5v for your reciever. This is a tiny one focussed on powering just your receiver.
A breakout cable is a great way to make wiring easier - splits out one XT30 to four red and four black wires for powering you drive escs, weapon, BEC and LED!
HDPE is an easily workable and affordable material. We recommend 10mm for structural walls and at least 4mm for everything else!
We find woodscrews the easiest way to hold together HDPE based beetle chassis. We recommend M4 ones!
Good way to fasten panels together at right angles
Small connectors great for removable links and internal connectors!
Removable link dock with built in mounts.
Light, link and fuse all in one kit!
Useful as power light.
Useful as power light.
Pre-removed from the drill casing and includes grub screws for locking the clutch. Cheap and gets the job done at 3-5S with an all metal planetary gearbox.
Custom CNC'd 15mm HDPE mounts specifically for BBB drills. Includes screws and and mounts for two drills
Runs one or two drill motors per side per ESC at up to 6S! Also suitable for brushed weapon motors such as scooties!
Pair of 100mm wheels with a threaded hub ready to be mounted on to any 3/8 UNF shaft (most drills)

Linear actuators are great for adding a lifter or grabber to your feather. Use a 12V linac with a beetle sized brushed esc on 3S - have look at what stroke length and speed works for your bot. Read our feather weapon guide for more info!

Powerful brushed motor for axes, hammers, lifters! We recommend ones with a built in gearbox. Often come with a sprocket - good to use with chain reduction. Read our feather weapon guide for more info!
Good option for a starter 3S feather. We recommend 3-5S lipos 2200-3000mAh with an XT60 connector.
BEC - battery eliminator circuit, reducing your battery voltage to 5v for your reciever.
A breakout cable is a great way to make wiring easier - splits out one XT60 to four red and four black wires for powering you drive escs, weapon, BEC and LED!
HDPE is an easily workable and affordable material. We recommend 20mm for structural walls and at least 8mm for everything else!
column13: HDPE is an easily workable and affordable material. We recommend 10mm for structural walls and at least 4mm for everything else!
column19: HDPE is an easily workable and affordable material. We recommend 10mm for structural walls and at least 4mm for everything else!
column25: HDPE is an easily workable and affordable material. We recommend 10mm for structural walls and at least 4mm for everything else!

column7: We find woodscrews the easiest way to hold together HDPE based featherweight chassis. We recommend going for larger than beetle so M5+
Barrel Nuts are a great way to join right angled pieces of HDPE together.
Larger connectors often found on LiPo packs
Removable link dock with built in mounts.
Light, link and fuse all in one kit!
Useful as power light.
Solder the connectors of these to your ESC for drive!
We worked with the manufacturer to make a higher rated current version well suited to bodgebots! Will run a bunch of the yellow motors no issue and minimal soldering required
Cheap and strong metal gear servo! Don't run above 6V (4AAs)
Comes with a switch and JST connector to directly connect to your dual ESC!

Good value transmitter for AFHDS/flysky recievers. Can have multiple profiles for multiple robots and has mixing. Comes with a 6 channel reciever but smaller ones can be bought separately for ants/beetles
